pullrequest.title: Fixed a typo in logging failures in the queue.

content.raw:
Wow! This bug has existed for over 3 years! The line of code was introduced in [this](#!/labscript_suite/blacs/src/93cb221dd440/main.pyw?at=gtk#cl-539) commit in an early version of GTK BLACS! It looks like I noticed something was wrong when I ported it to Qt, but still didn't add the required `%s`. 

I guess people don't often abort during transition to buffered!
content.html:
Wow! This bug has existed for over 3 years! The line of code was introduced in this commit in an early version of GTK BLACS! It looks like I noticed something was wrong when I ported it to Qt, but still didn't add the required %s.

I guess people don't often abort during transition to buffered!

pullrequest.title: Fixed a typo in logging failures in the queue.

content.raw:
I didn't even click abort, I think that one of the devices crashed on transition to buffered, which automatically triggered an abort?
I think I've had BLACS hang when things go wrong on transition to buffered before, but never looked into it. Was pretty obvious when looking at the log files though!

I think I've had BLACS hang when things go wrong on transition to buffered before, but never looked into it. Was pretty obvious when looking at the log files though!

pullrequest.title: Fixed a typo in logging failures in the queue.

content.raw: I'm actually surprised that BLACS had such a problem with the bug. That whole code is wrapped in a giant try/except which should have paused the queue and regenerated the h5 file. Can you provide more details in case there is another issue?
content.html: I'm actually surprised that BLACS had such a problem with the bug. That whole code is wrapped in a giant try/except which should have paused the queue and regenerated the h5 file. Can you provide more details in case there is another issue?

pullrequest.title: Fixed a typo in logging failures in the queue.

content.raw:
I'm not 100% sure on what was clicked when, but two of my tabs had crashed, one due to a h5 file access problem. I believe that the first (an rfblaster) crashed, pausing the queue and causing the abort bug, then the second (NI6363) crashed with the file access problem, possibly as a result?
I then restarted both tabs. The NI6363 tab was never redrawn and BLACS became unresponsive. I may have tried to unpause the queue immediately after restarting the tabs, but I can't remember? The log file shows the NI6363's tab being set up with unit calibrations, but then just ends
content.html: I'm not 100% sure on what was clicked when, but two of my tabs had crashed, one due to a h5 file access problem. I believe that the first (an rfblaster) crashed, pausing the queue and causing the abort bug, then the second (NI6363) crashed with the file access problem, possibly as a result? I then restarted both tabs. The NI6363 tab was never redrawn and BLACS became unresponsive. I may have tried to unpause the queue immediately after restarting the tabs, but I can't remember? The log file shows the NI6363's tab being set up with unit calibrations, but then just ends

pullrequest.title: Fixed a typo in logging failures in the queue.

content.raw:
Ok. It looks like the queue manager did handle the exception as expected. It should have still been functional, just displayed the incorrect error message in the queue manager. This pull request effectively fixes that incorrect error message.

The hard crash seems to be due to restarting tabs, which I've seen before, but haven't tracked down to anything. I suspect it may be the implementation of [DragDropTab](#!/labscript_suite/labscript_utils/src/72f238ecd8fa9a297d90f72bb26a180dcfe2f95a/qtwidgets/dragdroptab.py?at=default) class which I wrote when I was very new to Qt. It should really be re-written at some point!
content.html:
Ok. It looks like the queue manager did handle the exception as expected. It should have still been functional, just displayed the incorrect error message in the queue manager. This pull request effectively fixes that incorrect error message.

The hard crash seems to be due to restarting tabs, which I've seen before, but haven't tracked down to anything. I suspect it may be the implementation of DragDropTab class which I wrote when I was very new to Qt. It should really be re-written at some point!
